So one way of avoiding zombies is to install a signal handler that waits for the children as and when they die: /* this first line is needed on some systems to get POSIX behaviour */ #define _INCLUDE_POSIX_SOURCE #include <stdlib.h> #include <signal.h> #include <sys/wait.h> void waiter(int dummy) { int st; while (wait3(&st, WNOHANG, NULL) > 0); } int main(int argc, char *argv[]){ struct sigaction act; act.sa_handler=waiter; sigaction (SIGCHLD, &act, NULL) ; ... } You also should make sure that when the parent exits, it wait s for any children which have not yet finished.
